title: Phrack World News
historical_context: This article discusses the early efforts by the U.S. Secret Service to combat telephone fraud, a significant issue in the telecommunications industry during the 1980s.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, telecommunications industry stakeholders.
short_summary: This article covers the U.S. Secret Service's involvement in combating telephone fraud, detailing recent arrests and the methods used by fraudsters, including the use of Blue Boxes and stolen authorization codes.
summary: The article further discusses the collaborative efforts of MCI and the Communications Fraud Control Association (CFCA) in addressing the issue of telephone fraud. Everick Bowens, a senior manager at MCI, emphasizes the importance of industry-wide cooperation to combat this growing problem. The article also delves into the various types of fraud prevalent in the industry, including electronic toll fraud and the unauthorized use of stolen codes. Bowens provides insights into the profiles of typical offenders and the methods MCI employs to detect and investigate fraudulent activities. The piece serves as a historical snapshot of the telecommunications industry's battle against fraud during a time when hacking and phreaking were becoming increasingly sophisticated.
